Description: Shoulder and body fragment of East Greek pottery closed vase, probably oenochoe. On the shoulder, volute and leaf motif; below, stopt maeander band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Venit: 'Possibly School of the Oxford Oinochoe (Kardara, pp.207-11). For the complex on the shoulder compare, for example, Berlin 2939 (CVA Germany 33: pl.159 figs 2-4; Kardara, p.208 no.4), Rhodes 11544 (CVA Italy 10: pl.7 fig.1; Kardara, p.208 no.2), and Copenhagen 5607 (Kardara, p.208, no.3 and p. 209 fig. 179).'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 8, no. 20 pl. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.896)
